title: Calories in 2 Scrambled Eggs
meta_description: Discover calories in scrambled eggs 2, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, lightly salted; no milk or additional ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and seasonings. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two scrambled eggs provide ~182 kcal and ~12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 2 scrambled eggs?
Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 13.6 g total fat for two, mostly from the eggs and cooking butter.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in scrambled eggs 2?
faqs.a: Using oil instead of butter or adding milk increases calories; dry scrambling reduces them.
Yes, only ~1.4 g carbs in two scrambled eggs, with no fiber.
